display_name.description: Refers to the display name for the alert

refresh.description: Specifies the refresh schedule that Rill should follow to re-ingest and update the underlying data

watermark.description:
Specifies how the watermark is determined for incremental processing.
Use 'trigger_time' to set it at runtime or 'inherit' to use the upstream model's watermark.

intervals.description: define the interval of the alert to check

duration.description: a valid ISO8601 duration to define the interval duration

limit.description: maximum number of intervals to check for on invocation

check_unclosed.description: boolean, whether unclosed intervals should be checked

timeout.description: define the timeout of the alert in seconds (optional).

on_recover.description: Send an alert when a previously failing alert recovers. Defaults to false.

on_fail.description: Send an alert when a failure occurs. Defaults to true.

on_error.description: Send an alert when an error occurs during evaluation. Defaults to false.

renotify.description: Enable repeated notifications for unresolved alerts. Defaults to false.

renotify_after.description: Defines the re-notification interval for the alert (e.g., '10m', '24h'), equivalent to snooze duration in UI, defaults to 'Off'

notify.description: Defines how and where to send notifications. At least one method (email or Slack) is required.

display_name.description: Refers to the display name for the canvas

banner.description: Refers to the custom banner displayed at the header of an Canvas dashboard

max_width.description: Max width in pixels of the canvas

gap_x.description: Horizontal gap in pixels of the canvas

gap_y.description: Vertical gap in pixels of the canvas

theme.description: Name of the theme to use. Only one of theme and embedded_theme can be set.

allow_custom_time_range.description: Defaults to true, when set to false it will hide the ability to set a custom time range for the user.

time_ranges.description: Overrides the list of default time range selections available in the dropdown. It can be string or an object with a 'range' and optional 'comparison_offsets'

time_zones.description: Refers to the time zones that should be pinned to the top of the time zone selector. It should be a list of [IANA time zone identifiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)

filters.description: Indicates if filters should be enabled for the canvas.

defaults.description: Preset UI state to show by default

variables.description: Variables that can be used in the canvas

rows.description: Refers to all of the rows displayed on the Canvas

items.description: Refers to each row of components, multiple items can be listed in a single items

security.description: Security rules to apply for access to the canvas

display_name.description: Refers to the display name for the component

aws_access_key_id.description: AWS Access Key ID for Athena access

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS Secret Access Key for Athena access

aws_access_token.description: Optional AWS session token for temporary credentials

external_id.description: Optional External ID for assuming a role

role_arn.description: Optional AWS Role ARN to assume when accessing Athena

role_session_name.description: Optional Session name when assuming the role

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

azure_storage_sas_token.description: Optional azure SAS token for authentication

azure_storage_connection_string.description: Optional azure connection string for storage account

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

dsn.description: DSN(Data Source Name) for the ClickHouse connection

host.description: Host where the ClickHouse instance is running

port.description: Port where the ClickHouse instance is accessible

database.description: Name of the ClickHouse database within the cluster

ssl.description: Indicates whether a secured SSL connection is required

cluster.description: Cluster name, required for running distributed queries

log_queries.description: Controls whether to log raw SQL queries

settings_override.description: override the default settings used in queries. example `readonly = 1, session_timezone = 'UTC'`

embed_port.description: Port to run ClickHouse locally (0 for random port)

can_scale_to_zero.description: Indicates if the database can scale to zero

max_open_conns.description: Maximum number of open connections to the database

max_idle_conns.description: Maximum number of idle connections in the pool

dial_timeout.description: Timeout for dialing the ClickHouse server

conn_max_lifetime.description: Maximum time a connection may be reused

read_timeout.description: Maximum time for a connection to read data

google_application_credentials.description: Path to the Google Cloud credentials JSON file

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

dsn.description: Data Source Name (DSN) for connecting to Druid

host.description: Hostname of the Druid coordinator or broker

port.description: Port number of the Druid service

log_queries.description: Log raw SQL queries sent to Druid

max_open_conns.description: Maximum number of open database connections (0 = default, -1 = unlimited)

path.description: File path to the DuckDB database file

pool_size.description: Number of concurrent connections and queries allowed

allow_host_access.description: Whether access to the local environment and file system is allowed

cpu.description: Number of CPU cores available to the database

memory_limit_gb.description: Amount of memory in GB available to the database

read_write_ratio.description: Ratio of resources allocated to the read database; used to divide CPU and memory

boot_queries.description: SQL to run when initializing a new connection, before extensions and defaults

init_sql.description: SQL to run when initializing a new connection, after extensions and defaults

log_queries.description: Whether to log raw SQL queries executed through OLAP

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

key_id.description: Optional S3-compatible Key ID when used in compatibility mode

secret.description: Optional S3-compatible Secret when used in compatibility mode

path.description: The full HTTPS URI to fetch data from

headers.description: HTTP headers to include in the request

dsn.description: Data Source Name (DSN) indicating the file path or location of the local file

allow_host_access.description: Flag to indicate if access to host-level file paths is permitted

dsn.description: Data Source Name (DSN) specifying the MotherDuck connection endpoint
DSN(Data Source Name) for the mysql connection
DSN(Data Source Name) for the Pinot connection

broker_port.description: Port number for the Pinot broker

controller_port.description: Port number for the Pinot controller

log_queries.description: Log raw SQL queries executed through Pinot

max_open_conns.description: Maximum number of open connections to the Pinot database

dsn.description: DSN(Data Source Name) for the postgres connection

aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key ID for authentication

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key for authentication

aws_access_token.description: AWS session token for temporary credentials (optional)

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

aws_access_key_id.description: AWS Access Key ID used for authentication

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS Secret Access Key used for authentication

aws_access_token.description: Optional AWS session token for temporary credentials

endpoint.description: Optional custom endpoint URL for S3-compatible storage

region.description: AWS region of the S3 bucket

allow_host_access.description: Allow access to host environment configuration

retain_files.description: Whether to retain intermediate files after processing

client_id.description: Client ID used for Salesforce OAuth authentication

bot_token.description: Bot token used for authenticating Slack API requests

dsn.description: DSN (Data Source Name) for the Snowflake connection

parallel_fetch_limit.description: Maximum number of concurrent fetches during query execution

dsn.description: DSN(Data Source Name) for the sqlite connection

display_name.description: Refers to the display name for the explore dashboard

description.description: Refers to the description of the explore dashboard

banner.description: Refers to the custom banner displayed at the header of an explore dashboard

metrics_view.description: Refers to the metrics view resource

dimensions.description:
can be:
1. The string '*'
2. An array of strings
3. An object with one of: 'regex', 'expr', or 'exclude'

measures.description:
can be:
1. The string '*'
2. An array of strings
3. An object with one of: 'regex', 'expr', or 'exclude'

theme.description: Name of the theme to use. Only one of theme and embedded_theme can be set.

time_ranges.description: Overrides the list of default time range selections available in the dropdown. It can be string or an object with a 'range' and optional 'comparison_offsets'

time_zones.description: Refers to the time zones that should be pinned to the top of the time zone selector. It should be a list of [IANA time zone identifiers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)

lock_time_zone.description: When true, the dashboard will be locked to the first time provided in the time_zones list. When no time_zones are provided, the dashboard will be locked to UTC

allow_custom_time_range.description: Defaults to true, when set to false it will hide the ability to set a custom time range for the user.

dimensions.description: Provides the default dimensions to load on viewing the dashboard

measures.description: Provides the default measures to load on viewing the dashboard

time_range.description: Refers to the default time range shown when a user initially loads the dashboard. The value must be either a valid [ISO 8601 duration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) (for example, PT12H for 12 hours, P1M for 1 month, or P26W for 26 weeks) or one of the [Rill ISO 8601 extensions](https://docs.rilldata.com/reference/rill-iso-extensions#extensions)

comparison_mode.description: Controls how to compare current data with historical or categorical baselines. Options: 'none' (no comparison), 'time' (compares with past based on default_time_range), 'dimension' (compares based on comparison_dimension values)

comparison_dimension.description: for dimension mode, specify the comparison dimension by name

security.description: Security rules to apply for access to the explore dashboard

oneOf.description: Advanced matching using regex, DuckDB expression, or exclusion

regex.description: Select dimensions using a regular expression

exclude.description: Select all dimensions except those listed here

display_name.description: Refers to the display name for the metrics view

description.description: Refers to the description for the metrics view

model.description: Refers to the model powering the dashboard (either model or table is required)

database.description: Refers to the database to use in the OLAP engine (to be used in conjunction with table). Otherwise, will use the default database or schema if not specified

database_schema.description: Refers to the schema to use in the OLAP engine (to be used in conjunction with table). Otherwise, will use the default database or schema if not specified

table.description: Refers to the table powering the dashboard, should be used instead of model for dashboards create from external OLAP tables (either table or model is required)

timeseries.description: Refers to the timestamp column from your model that will underlie x-axis data in the line charts. If not specified, the line charts will not appear

watermark.description: A SQL expression that tells us the max timestamp that the metrics are considered valid for. Usually does not need to be overwritten

smallest_time_grain.description: Refers to the smallest time granularity the user is allowed to view. The valid values are: millisecond, second, minute, hour, day, week, month, quarter, year

first_day_of_week.description: Refers to the first day of the week for time grain aggregation (for example, Sunday instead of Monday). The valid values are 1 through 7 where Monday=1 and Sunday=7

first_month_of_year.description: Refers to the first month of the year for time grain aggregation. The valid values are 1 through 12 where January=1 and December=12

dimensions.description: Relates to exploring segments or dimensions of your data and filtering the dashboard

name.description: a stable identifier for the dimension

display_name.description: a display name for your dimension

description.description: a freeform text description of the dimension

expression.description: a non-aggregate expression such as string_split(domain, '.'). One of column and expression is required but cannot have both at the same time

unnest.description: if true, allows multi-valued dimension to be unnested (such as lists) and filters will automatically switch to "contains" instead of exact match

uri.description: enable if your dimension is a clickable URL to enable single click navigation (boolean or valid SQL expression)

measures.description: Used to define the numeric aggregates of columns from your data model

name.description: a stable identifier for the measure

display_name.description: the display name of your measure.

description.description: a freeform text description of the dimension

expression.description: a combination of operators and functions for aggregations

window.description: A measure window can be defined as a keyword string (e.g., 'time' or 'all') or an object with detailed window configuration.

anyOf.description: Shorthand: 'time' or 'true' means time-partitioned, 'all' means non-partitioned.

frame.description: sets the frame of your window

requires.description: using an available measure or dimension in your metrics view to set a required parameter, cannot be used with simple measures

format_preset.description:
Controls the formatting of this measure using a predefined preset. Measures cannot have both `format_preset` and `format_d3`. If neither is supplied, the measure will be formatted using the `humanize` preset by default. Available options:
- `humanize`: Round numbers into thousands (K), millions (M), billions (B), etc.
- `none`: Raw output.
- `currency_usd`: Round to 2 decimal points with a dollar sign ($).
- `currency_eur`: Round to 2 decimal points with a euro sign (€).
- `percentage`: Convert a rate into a percentage with a % sign.
- `interval_ms`: Convert milliseconds into human-readable durations like hours (h), days (d), years (y), etc. (optional)

format_d3.description: Controls the formatting of this measure using a [d3-format](https://d3js.org/d3-format) string. If an invalid format string is supplied, the measure will fall back to `format_preset: humanize`. A measure cannot have both `format_preset` and `format_d3`. If neither is provided, the humanize preset is used by default. Example: `format_d3: ".2f"` formats using fixed-point notation with two decimal places. Example: `format_d3: ",.2r"` formats using grouped thousands with two significant digits. (optional)

format_d3_locale.description: locale configuration passed through to D3, enabling changing the currency symbol among other things. For details, see the docs for D3's [formatLocale](https://d3js.org/d3-format#formatLocale)

valid_percent_of_total.description: a boolean indicating whether percent-of-total values should be rendered for this measure

treat_nulls_as.description: used to configure what value to fill in for missing time buckets. This also works generally as COALESCING over non empty time buckets.

security.description: Defines a security policy for the dashboard

anyOf.description: Shorthand field selector, interpreted as the name.

refresh.description: Specifies the refresh schedule that Rill should follow to re-ingest and update the underlying model data

timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for model ingestion

state.description: Refers to the explicitly defined state of your model, cannot be used with partitions (optional)

partitions.description: Refers to the how your data is partitioned, cannot be used with state. (optional)

sql.description: Raw SQL query to run against source

materialize.description: models will be materialized in olap

partitions_watermark.description: Refers to a customizable timestamp that can be set to check if an object has been updated (optional).

partitions_concurrency.description: Refers to the number of concurrent partitions that can be read at the same time (optional).

connector.description: Refers to the connector type for the staging table

stage.description: in the case of staging models, where an input source does not support direct write to the output and a staging table is required

output.description: to define the properties of output

connector.description: Refers to the connector type for the output table

display_name.description: the display name of your report.

refresh.description: Specifies the refresh schedule that Rill should follow to re-ingest and update the underlying data

watermark.description:
Specifies how the watermark is determined for incremental processing.
Use 'trigger_time' to set it at runtime or 'inherit' to use the upstream model's watermark.

intervals.description: define the interval of the report to check

duration.description: a valid ISO8601 duration to define the interval duration

limit.description: maximum number of intervals to check for on invocation

check_unclosed.description: boolean, whether unclosed intervals should be checked

timeout.description: define the timeout of the report in seconds (optional).

format.description: Format for exported report: can be 'csv', 'xlsx', or 'parquet'.

notify.description: Defines how and where to send notifications. At least one method (email or Slack) is required

version.description: Version of the parser to use for this file. Enables backwards compatibility for breaking changes.

name.description: Name is usually inferred from the filename, but can be specified manually.

namespace.description: Optional value to group resources by. Prepended to the resource name as <namespace>/<name>.

oneOf.description: An object reference with at least a 'name' and 'type'.

refs.description: List of resource references, each as a string or map.

value.description: The value can be of any type.

sql.description: Raw SQL query to run against existing models in the project.

connector.description: specifies the connector to use when running SQL or glob queries.

metrics_sql.description: SQL query that targets a metrics view in the project

api.description: Name of a custom API defined in the project.

args.description: Arguments to pass to the custom API.

glob.description: Defines the file path or pattern to query from the specified connector.

connector.description: Specifies the connector to use with the glob input.

where_error.description: Indicates whether the condition should trigger when the resource is in an error state.

oneOf.description: a valid [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) duration or one of the [Rill ISO 8601 extensions](https://docs.rilldata.com/reference/rill-iso-extensions#extensions) extensions for the selection

range.description: a valid [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) duration or one of the [Rill ISO 8601 extensions](https://docs.rilldata.com/reference/rill-iso-extensions#extensions) extensions for the selection

comparison_offsets.description: list of time comparison options for this time range selection (optional). Must be one of the [Rill ISO 8601 extensions](https://docs.rilldata.com/reference/rill-iso-extensions#extensions)

recipients.description: An array of email addresses to notify.

users.description: An array of Slack user IDs to notify.

channels.description: An array of Slack channel IDs to notify.

webhooks.description: An array of Slack webhook URLs to send notifications to.

ref_update.description: If true, allows the resource to run when a dependency updates.

cron.description: A cron expression that defines the execution schedule

every.description: Run at a fixed interval using a Go duration string (e.g., '1h', '30m', '24h'). See: https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration

time_zone.description: Time zone to interpret the schedule in (e.g., 'UTC', 'America/Los_Angeles').

disable.description: If true, disables the resource without deleting it.

run_in_dev.description: If true, allows the schedule to run in development mode.

access.description: Expression indicating if the user should be granted access to the dashboard. If not defined, it will resolve to false and the dashboard won't be accessible to anyone. Needs to be a valid SQL expression that evaluates to a boolean.

row_filter.description: SQL expression to filter the underlying model by. Can leverage templated user attributes to customize the filter for the requesting user. Needs to be a valid SQL expression that can be injected into a WHERE clause

include.description: List of dimension or measure names to include in the dashboard. If include is defined all other dimensions and measures are excluded

if.description: Expression to decide if the column should be included or not. It can leverage templated user attributes. Needs to be a valid SQL expression that evaluates to a boolean

names.description: List of fields to include. Should match the name of one of the dashboard's dimensions or measures

exclude.description: List of dimension or measure names to exclude from the dashboard. If exclude is defined all other dimensions and measures are included

if.description: Expression to decide if the column should be excluded or not. It can leverage templated user attributes. Needs to be a valid SQL expression that evaluates to a boolean

names.description: List of fields to exclude. Should match the name of one of the dashboard's dimensions or measures
